pullRequest.body:
Also add `FreeAlgebra.cardinalMk_eq_max_lift`, etc. parallel to `MvPolynomial`.

Also fix the name `cardinal_lift_mk_le_max` -> `cardinalMk_le_max_lift` for `MvPolynomial`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #19286

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> Dependency changes
> 
> File	Base Count	Head Count	Change
> Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.FreeAlgebra	1179	1194	+15 (+1.27%)

Oops, seems that this result should moved to another file

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19286~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

After the proof changes, `#find_home IntermediateField.lift_cardinalMk_adjoin_le` suggests that

> Mathlib.FieldTheory.NormalClosure, Mathlib.RingTheory.Nullstellensatz, Mathlib.FieldTheory.Fixed, Mathlib.RingTheory.WittVector.FrobeniusFractionField, Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Eigenspace.Triangularizable, Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.FDRep

But none of them seems appropriate. Perhaps `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Cardinality` is OK, or is it too late?

Importing Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Subfield into FieldTheory.Adjoin only adds 3 trans imports (1261 to 1264), which is reasonable to me. Mathlib.FieldTheory.Cardinality imports 1307 files so indeed seems a bit "late".

> Importing Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Subfield into FieldTheory.Adjoin only adds 3 trans imports (1261 to 1264), which is reasonable to me. Mathlib.FieldTheory.Cardinality imports 1307 files so indeed seems a bit "late".

Done.

Thanks ðŸŽ‰ 
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
These 3 lines are very slow. Any suggestions to improve them?

We're already in the namespace (and elsewhere)
```suggestion
  rw [equivMonoidAlgebraFreeMonoid.toEquiv.cardinal_eq, MonoidAlgebra,
```

Not sure what caused the particular slowness but here's a proof without using FractionRing which also gets rid of the extra import:
```suggestion
open Cardinal in
theorem lift_cardinalMk_adjoin_le {E : Type v} [Field E] [Algebra F E] (s : Set E) :
    Cardinal.lift.{u} #(adjoin F s) â‰¤ Cardinal.lift.{v} #F âŠ” Cardinal.lift.{u} #s âŠ” â„µâ‚€ := by
  rw [show â†¥(adjoin F s) = (adjoin F s).toSubfield from rfl, adjoin_toSubfield]
  apply (Cardinal.lift_le.mpr (Subfield.cardinalMk_closure_le_max _)).trans
  rw [lift_max, sup_le_iff, lift_aleph0]
  refine âŸ¨(Cardinal.lift_le.mpr ((mk_union_le _ _).trans <| add_le_max _ _)).trans ?_, le_sup_rightâŸ©
  simp_rw [lift_max, lift_aleph0, sup_assoc]
  exact sup_le_sup_right mk_range_le_lift _
```
Thank you very much!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `(Algebra|IntermediateField).lift_cardinalMk_adjoin_le`
